rComments: Lectures were sometimes tangents and unorganized, but he really cares about his class. He's a tough love kind of person in class, but if you meet with him outside of class he will go above and beyond so you can understand the material.

This class isn't any harder than your typical college bio class. It's definitely easy to do well if you put enough time and effort into this class. Listen to his webcasts, go to the TA office hours and sections, and don't wait till the last minute to study for his exams. Clicker questions during class are a big grade booster.

Most of the oeiple complaing about Sanford aren't ready to take on an upper div Bio class. Is he the best professor? No, however you can tell how passionate he is about the subject. He can get off track, which is frustrating, but he gets through most of the material. iClickers, the textbook, and office hours/section are the keys to success

If a professor addresses his entire class with the laconic and sadly accurate statement of "yeah, we're sorta screwed right now," with only five minutes before the end of the final lecture, that's not a good sign in anyone's book!

Though he may be a brilliant researcher and okay guy, Sanford is a horrible teacher. He places WAY TOO MUCH emphasis on rote memorization of structures rather than conceptual understanding, he's a terrible explainer, and his tests can be devilishly difficult. I love biochemistry as a subject, but his class was one of the worst classes I've taken.

Do not take this class with Sanford. He has been one of the most unorganized professors I've had at UCSC. His tests were brutal. By the end of the quarter he was very behind and decided to pack as much as he could into the last two lectures and screw everyone in the class. Prepare to teach yourself. He expects a lot without giving much.

This class is co-taught by Stone who I really liked, but I found Sanford to be unreasonable. He asked fairly standard questions for example, what enzyme does this thing in the Kreb's cycle ? Instead of giving you the names of enzymes as your answer choices he gives you chemical structure. This would be a reasonable question for sugars but not this.

He was really nice actually. I would call myself a pretty studios person, and with a lot of effort got an A. All of the lectures are webcasted, so you'll be able to rematch what he taught. Honestly, I thought with a decent amount of effort the class was easy. I would say most complainers are just not quiet ready for an upper div bio class.

Horrible. Came to class and review session without any preparation. His half of midterm 2 was tricky and asked questions on things we hadn't covered yet. The final was ridiculous because a third of it was just on chemical structures which he didn't tell us we needed to know.
I wish he was more organized and prepared for this class.
Awesome professor. Very approachable and has a good sense of humor which made lectures less painful. Would definitely take him again for another class!
Super confusing tests. Very tricky and specific. Extremely exhausting lecturer, likes to power through breaks and keeps you late.

Reasonable lecturer, but tests are long multiple choice monstrosities. Also, grading is a bit unreasonable. I got no lower than 85% on every assignment, even though the averages should have merited a curve. Also did 2 extra credit assignments. Still got a B. Seems unfair to ask for students to do extra credit if you aren't going to give them any.

Sanford may not be the best lecturer but he is very helpful and approachable in office hours. go to office hr, often times he we drop hints for exam questions. I thought his final was easy (study his slides & memorize glycolysis, TCA, ETC pathways). do the extra credits & there is a curve!

He talks faster than you can write and doesn't write much on his lecture slides. I found it more helpful not to go to class but watch the podcasts later. That way I can pause and go back. His tests were way harder than the material he went over. He goes on tangents a lot. Be ready to teach yourself the material. Seems like a nice guy though.

This class wasn't very hard. Read the book & go to lecture. His office hours are very helpful. He posts lecture slides, gives study guides & emailed everyone & told them what score they would need on the final for an A or a B etc. This is an upper div class! If you can't teach yourself this stuff with his help then you should change your major.

Super cute, but you HAVE to teach yourself. The test answers are online so that made it easy for some. He's not very clear or confident, but he's self aware and will give you a good grade to make up for his shortcomings. If you don't have the test answers they're HARD because its on small stuff in the readings that he doesn't go over. Eh. He's new.

Puts you to sleep, he just sounds really tired and depressed and that's how you will feel sitting in lecture, does not have any enthusiasm for teaching and struggles through lectures to get it out of the way
